body_content.explanation: to bring something together again in a large number or amount in one particular area:
examples: By reconcentrating widely dispersed households in larger villages, the government sought to deny the rebels access to food and supplies.
They have re-concentrated powers in the hands of the administration.

body_content.explanation: to make a liquid or substance stronger and reduce its size again, by removing water from it:
examples: All filtrates were pooled and re-concentrated as described above.
Every animal grows by re-concentrating elements previously dispersed in surrounding plants or other animals.
